title: The Week in Ransomware - November 3rd 2023 - Hive's Back
description: Over the past couple of months, ransomware attacks have been escalating as new operations launch, old ones return, and existing operations continue to target the enterprise. [...]

title: Dutch hacker jailed for extortion, selling stolen data on RaidForums
description: A former Dutch cybersecurity professional was sentenced to four years in prison after being found guilty of hacking and blackmailing more than a dozen companies in the Netherlands and worldwide. [...]

title: American Airlines pilot union hit by ransomware attack
description: Allied Pilots Association (APA), a labor union representing 15,000 American Airlines pilots, disclosed a ransomware attack that hit its systems on Monday. [...]

title: Google Play adds security audit badges for Android VPN apps
description: Google Play, Android's official app store, is now tagging VPN apps with an 'independent security reviews' badge if they conducted an independent security audit of their software and platform. [...]

title: New Microsoft Exchange zero-days allow RCE, data theft attacks
description: Microsoft Exchange is impacted by four zero-day vulnerabilities that attackers can exploit remotely to execute arbitrary code or disclose sensitive information on affected installations. [...]

title: Okta breach: 134 customers exposed in October support system hack
description: Okta says attackers who breached its customer support system last month gained access to files belonging to 134 customers, five of them later being targeted in session hijacking attacks with the help of stolen session tokens. [...]
